Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content: @Alright yes, I'm aware. In fact, webby and I were discussing it last night, the comment in komodo source combined with my lack of knowledge of C gave me the wrong impression that it could be done

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content:
the "compromise" I came up with is that k-nomp will not "entirely" burn tx fees, but subtract that amount from pool op's fees (vout1) while adding to vout0
Mathematically it's the same to the cb as burning them, but this way ops take the hit and not miners

Author: Alright#0419
Content: that seems rather bad solution

Author: Alright#0419
Content: can send txs with inputs > outputs then steal from pool op

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content:
`can send txs with inputs > outputs then steal from pool op`
What are you really "stealing" if you spend 2.56 ARRR to get 2.56 ARRR? At best you're breaking even. Granted it leaves no financial overhead to be a dick and leave the op with a 0 fee; but, currently the only other alternatives are "Hey, that tx fee you just paid, no one gets it it just gets vaporized" and rewriting the entire payout system of any nomp fork you want to support

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: everyone **ATTN Pool Operators:** We are just about 28 hours away from the biggest network update that Komodo ever had. Please make sure you have your Komodo and assetchain daemon and pool software updated to support sapling. Don't risk going on fork. Wasting hash in a forked pool would be pointless. To avoid that, all you have to do is update your pool with sapling ready source. If you need help, please ask questions here. We have experienced pool operators and engineers here to help you out. Help us to carry out the major network upgrade smoothly. Thanks for your contribution.
